definition: to open up/to spread/sheet of paper/classifier for flat objects, sheet/classifier for votes
to unstring a bow/to slacken/to relax/to loosen

sentences.english: Another system investigated is an electronic relaxation oscillator.
sentences.chinese: 本文讨论的另一个系统是一个电子张弛电路。

sentences.english: The thermal relaxation time of small drops and particles in air is quite short.
sentences.chinese: 空气中小水滴和粒子的热张弛时间是非常短的。

sentences.english: Representing the self-containedness, self-restraint and the essence of well-balanced tension and relaxation of the oriental culture.
sentences.chinese: 是体现东方文化的内敛，涵养，处世的张弛有度。

sentences.english: Mature women will give a man some space and he can be a degree of relaxation.
sentences.chinese: 成熟的女人会对给男人一些空间又能做到张弛有度。

sentences.english: I just wish you were my boss, keeping me on the straight and narrow.
sentences.chinese: 我就希望你是我的老板，对我的管理张弛有度。

sentences.english: We have known, for a long time, that regulation is about balance.
sentences.chinese: 长久以来我们都知道监管就是要张弛有度。

definition: old place name (in modern Linyi county 臨猗縣|临猗县, Shanxi)/two-character surname Linghu
Jiangchuan county in Yuxi 玉溪[Yu4 xi1], Yunnan
Xuan Yuan, personal name of Huangdi, the Yellow Emperor 黃帝|黄帝[Huang2 di4]
to ramble/to rove/old variant of 熬[ao2]
Lingyun county in Baise 百色[Bai3 se4], Guangxi
dagger-axe/abbr. for 戈瑞[ge1 rui4]/(Tw) abbr. for 戈雷[ge1 lei2]
